runs.comm: back of a length, on off, played off the back foot to cover
strays on the pads, turned away to square leg where Duminy stumbles and misfields and they get two
bounce there, just from back of a length, Gayle plays with the bottom hand off the handle
length delivery, dabbed to cover and they come through for one
beaten outside off, hint of swing away, Fletcher prods at it
angles this into him, he gets across and plays it to square leg
straight ball, on a length, played to wide of mid-on
angled across him, Fletcher walks across the stumps, is hit on the pad, there is a shout, but it hasn't come back enough
back of a length, straight, played to mid-on
big agricultural heave, is nowhere near the line of the ball, misses comprehensively, Parnell is fast and straight and gets the off stump, two ducks in a row for Fletcher
on the pads and tucked away for one
full, on off, defended solidly
square-driven between cover and point, good start from Simmons
short and wide, looks to cut, but the back foot doesn't go across and he misses
short, closer to him, chops it, but can't beat point
that's a flat-bat, short and wide, Simmons makes room, and throws his bat wholesomely at it, hit in front of square
slower ball, outside off, dabbed away to third man
length ball, driven powerfully, but can't get it past mid-on

Gayle is gone! Parnell strikes again, length ball, on the stumps, Gayle looks to go voer midwicket, can't clear Botha at midwicket, who doesn't even celebrate, throws it to the bowlers, for a moment one thought this was a no-ball. A big, big wicket, though
looks to flick off the back foot, misses, they get a leg-bye
fulltoss, hit straight to mid-on, for a moment it seemed it could carry to the fielder
short, angling across, defended off the back foot
full delivery, looks for the big drive, plays away from the body, gets an inside edge for one
walks a long way across, looks to clear the leg-side field, but misses, and he is saved the lbw because he has walked outside off
goes for four first ball, good-looking shot too, drives on the up, over mid-off, holds the elbow high
pulled off one leg, gets one to square leg
smashed through covers, Simmons makes room, and throws his arms at it, and not a body moves in the circle
and he has bowled just the ball he shouldn't have had, short, into the body, pulled away and beats short fine
it's a slower one, too full, almost a half-volley outside off, plants the front foot out, and gives it his all, clears covers easily, one-bounce four
another slower ball, Simmons sees it again, looks to run it down, can't create much distance with Boucher, will be just one
length ball, on the pads, turned away for one
poor bowl just because fine leg is up, strays onto the pads, Bravo flicks it coolly, beats short fine and gets four more
back of a length, outside off, dropped into the covers for one
that's half slog half pull, it's not too short and Simmons is on the front foot, but he swings across the line, flat and fast, gets four to midwicket
looks to make room, but can't, still drops it into the covers and scampers through
accurate, back of a length, on the middle stump, defended
Simmons looks for the reverse, Botha fires it down the leg side, big wide and they run a bye
angled into the pads, and turned away to deep square leg
outside off, and run down to third man
straight and flat, hit down to long-on for one
gets the reverse-sweep right this time, square on the off side, gets two
orthodox sweep, finds the gap between deep backward square and fine leg, good bisection
makes room, looks to go over off side, Morkel throws it wide, Bravo's bottom hand comes off as he hits it over point

what a catch, but a no-ball, it was a high fulltoss that surprised Bravo, who defended one-handed, so sharp it was it lobbed towards mid-on, Smith ran in from midwicket to catch, but rightly called no-ball
back of a length, into the body, turned around the corner
Simmons looks to scoop, Morkel blows the slower one, all he manages is a leg-bye
full and straight, driven down the ground
well bowled, Morkel saw Simmons make room, so threw it wide, but it is called wide, touch and go again
gets the scoop right this time, early movement across the stumps, picks the length ball and hits it to right of short fine
short and wide, he lets it go, waiting for the wide call, but it is not
short to start, and Bravo lofts it straight down the ground for one
AB is superb at short cover, that was hit powerfully to his right, but superb diving save
looks to sweep, misses, gets a leg-bye
flighted on the middle stump, driven down the ground
darts this one in, hit towards sweeper-cover

that inside-out shot gets Bravo this time, makes room and goes through with that shot beautifully, but two things go wrong: van der Merwe has followed him so he is too close to it, and the long-off is wider than usual, the net result: Bravo picks out Steyn
short, spinning in, hit to cover
goes for the slog-sweep, misses and gets a leg-bye
angled in from round the stumps, turned around the corner
that's drilled straight, this was flat and full so he didn't have to wait for it and lofted it straight down the ground
short, goes for the pull, is late into it, but goes two to wide of long-on
this is Simmons's version of the inside-out, full and flat again, stands his ground, opens the face and drills it over extra cover
looks for reverse-sweep, misses, is hit on the pad on the full, but outside off
looks for the reverse again, misses again, is hit outside the line of off again
plays in front of square this time, steps down, hits to wide of long-on and gets two
clipped from the middle-stump line for one
flat ans short, played with an open face, gets to his 50, very good knock but he needs to carry on
that was nearly gone, but he gets four, finally gets the reverse going, but it is top edged and lobbed just clear of Smith at short third
flighted outside off, played with an open face, gets one

lovely bowling, sees Chanderpaul come down the track, but still flights it nicely, gets it to dip, Chanderpaul plays it in front him because of the dip, and plays it back to Duminy. Any regular offspinner will be proud of this
lands just short, short, and Sarwan pulls, doesn't get enough bat, and Botha dives in from deep midwicket, but gets it on half-volley
almost gone again, mis-hits a straight loft, lucky that it doesn't carry to long-on
short and pulls it along the ground for one
short, turning in, and cut away to sweeper-cover
steps out and hits it hard straight down the ground, by the time long-on dives and saves it is two
Bravo will be proud of this one, makes room, elegantly, fluidly, goes over extra cover, it's struck sweetly enough to get him six
and goes for a reverse hoick, Bravo won't be proud of this one, is beaten and gets one leg-bye
steps out, looks for the single but dabs it straight back
on the pads, clipped to square of fine leg and they come back for two
full outside off, but hit straight to cover
shot! what timing, this was short, he made room, and flat-batted it down the ground, long-off needed three steps to get to it, but couldn't, lovely little gem Simmons is playing
another inside-out shot, nicely timed, Gibbs dives from extra cover, but can't get to it
cut from in front of the stump, square of cover, gets two
strange call from Benson, Simmons jumps out, Duminy bowls down the leg side, Simmons kicks it out, but gets a leg-bye
played down the ground for one
tires the reverse shot again, is beaten just outside what would have been off
Sarwan drives on the up, from outside off, to sweeper-cover
bouncer, is beaten on the pull, waits for the call on the height but doesn't get it
just misses out on the scoop shot, walks across, and Kallis bowls a cutter, which goes over the stumps
second bouncer of the over, and he pulls it with a vengeance, finds the gap in the leg side, what a response from the young man
steps out, and Kallis comes back well, bowls a slower ball, yorker that too, dot ball
well done Boucher, fulltoss outside off, Simmons gets an inside edge, it's travelling to left of Boucher, who dives full length and saves four
outside off, driven to cover for one
flighted well, hit down the ground for one
sees Sarwan step out, darts this one in, good bowling, just one
pulls this one to midwicket, looks for two, but Botha is quick
jumps out, misses, VDM goes for the run-out, and gives away an overthrow off the direct hit
darted down the leg side, way down the leg side

they finally get Simmons, full and flat, Simmons hits it down the ground, doesn't get enough elevation and picks out long-off, but a knock this one has been. Take a bow Simmons, he has kept WI in this one
Sarwan goes for a laborious 8 off 11 balls. This was short and wide, but a slower ball, and he ended up going in front of square, but straight to sweeper-cover
full and fast, Pollard bunts and runs
goes for the wide bouncer, Ramdin can't get the upper-cut, and plays it down the ground
nice shot, mid-off is up, picks this length ball and pummells it over mid-off's head
slower ball, hit powerfully down the ground, but long-off will field easily
nice yorker, on middle stump, dug out for one
on the pads, fine leg in, and Ramdin misses out, gets only one leg-bye

almost a yorker, dug out, goes to Smith at cover, who starts celebrating, Pollard thinks this is a bump ball, Benson discusses with Dar and goes to third umpire. Replays show it is a low fulltoss, and the puff of dust comes from bat hitting the ground. Hang on! Strange! Given not-out! What drama. It was the wrong button pressed, the third umpire corrects himself. Long as they correct themselves in time, off goes Pollard
an undisputed Yorker, gets one to point
he has made a mess of the stumps here, yorker, straight and fast, and Taylor plays all over it. 4 for 4 for Parnell, very close to best-ever figures in a Twenty20, which is 4 for 7 as it stands now
another yorker, big man Benn takes time to come down on it, gets a single to the left of Parnell
almost a five-for, another yorker, superb control, scoops it over point, just over
makes room, gets a yorker, played down the ground
another yorker, this is nice bowling, played with an open face, gets one
good shot, backs away again, this time Steyn tries to follow him with a short one, but he pulls well, over midwicket
what a scoop shot, to Steyn's pace, walks across, bends low, takes it from outside off, clears fine leg
makes room to go down the ground, gets a full ball, which he hits hard, but can't beat mid-off
Ramdin tries the cute scoop this time, Steyn is full and fast, too fast for him and takes out the leg stump
swinging yorker, defended off the back foot
into the pads, turned around the corner
another yorker, lovely accurate bowling
another yorker, this is boring, Wayne, another dot ball. But seriously, superb display of consistent yorkers
fulltoss this time, and played down the ground for one
low fulltoss and a single to finish this off, strong win for SA
